selection_reasoning: The selection prioritizes the current best-performing SLSQP frameworks (6_0, 7_0) while carrying forward diverse initialization strategies (QMC 7_4, Force-directed 7_2) and a global optimization metaheuristic (Basin-hopping 7_1) to break through the current score plateau.

trial_selections.reasoning: Current best overall (2.635983). It uses a robust multi-start SLSQP with vectorized Jacobian and shaking. It remains the strongest base for further refinement.
Best of the current generation (2.630972). It implements a refined multi-start SLSQP approach with jittering.
Strong performance (2.628315) using Quasi-Monte Carlo (Sobol/Halton style) initialization, which provides a more structured search of the configuration space than random starts.
Uses a force-directed (repulsion) initialization. This geometric approach often finds different packing topologies that gradient descent might miss.
Basin-hopping approach. While the score is lower (2.6135), the global search capability of basin-hopping is valuable for escaping the local optima that seem to be capping the SLSQP scores.
